climbs.name: Zig Zag
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes, Loren Scott and Chris Miller, November 2015

content.description: A varied route which ends with its own anchor just left of Benchmarks'. It tends up and right.
content.location: This is the 3rd sport route on the cliff, just right of Slipping into Darkness.

content.description: Easy slab leads to an undercling and the start of the difficulties up a shallow and delicate groove that relents to easier terrain the last third of the route.
content.location:
Located 20 feet right of

Benchmark

and identified as a shallow groove.

climbs.name: Slipping into Darkness
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes, Kiana Nakamura & Loren Scott

content.description: It follows an "elephants trunk" thru the center of the rock. Near its end, we found the rightmost ending the best.
content.protection: 7 lead bolts and two alternate endings with two separate anchors.
content.location: This is the secondmost route encountered, just right of Slip-Sliding.

climbs.name: Slip-Sliding Away
climbs.fa: Brad Singer and Pete Paredes, August 2007

content.description: Crux moves past the first 2 bolts on a friction slab lead higher up to a small roof. Passing the roof on the left is 5.10a and on the right is 5.8.
content.location: Leftmost of the sport routes on cliff.

content.description: Easy entry moves take one to the 1st bolt. The second bolt is side-clipped from out left as is the technical entry to the crux section which is traversed into. Extreme underclings with a strenuous compression move on the steep friction establishes the climber for the following moves to bolt 3. The climb eases considerably thereafter. Take a little care on the 5.9 finishing moves after the last bolt because of the proximity of possible ledging.
content.location: This is the 4th sport route from the left
